intro: Arthrostemma exiguum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved arthrostemum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant features slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pale blue or violet, with two lips, and bloom during the summer months. It is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in humid conditions.
